achievement_text: Creating AI-based tools for accelerating mixed-signal integrated circuit design (analog and digital).

Built circuit_explorer: FunSearch-inspired LLM exploration engine for analog/digital circuits. LLM generates Python circuit constructors, evaluated via ngspice/Optuna two-stage optimization. Supports Claude, OpenAI, HuggingFace, and local llama.cpp backends.

Developed virtuoso_adapter: Python automation framework for Cadence Virtuoso with bidirectional SKILL bridge. Enables automated ADC characterization (ENOB/SFDR/SNR), waveform analysis (PSF to NumPy), and remote Spectre simulation.
Created ngspice_playground: Docker-based EDA environments with analog (NGSPICE + SKY130 PDK) and digital (Yosys + OpenROAD + ASAP7) toolchains, GPU-accelerated ML, and CI/CD automation.
Developed memcfg_opt: Bayesian optimization tool (Optuna) for ARM SRAM design. Multi-objective optimization (area, timing, power), 10-100x faster than grid search, with 1027+ tests and 95% coverage.
Built hf_quantizer: CLI tool for 4-bit model quantization using SINQ (Sinkhorn-Normalized Quantization) with automated HuggingFace Hub deployment and HumanEval verification.
Created mcp_kiwi: Model Context Protocol server connecting Claude to internal wiki (Outline), with LRU caching, rate limiting, YunoHost SSO, and full document/collection CRUD.
Developed internal Claude Code plugin marketplace for team-wide AI tool distribution and management.
Built and led a multidisciplinary team of experts to develop innovative solutions for reducing switching activity and power consumption in Huawei's GPUs.
Designed and developed GENIAL (github.com/huawei-csl/GENIAL): ML framework for iterative generation of multiplier circuits with reduced switching activity. Accepted at ASP-DAC 2026.
Built oss_eda_base (github.com/huawei-csl/oss_eda_base): Docker base image bundling open-source EDA tools (Yosys, ABC, Verilator) for reproducible synthesis pipelines on SLURM clusters.
Proved that Network Inversion outperforms other state-of-the-art methods for design generation and design space exploration.
Results: achieved up to 18% switching activity reduction in multipliers on AI workloads compared to conventional two's complement encoding.
Developed a predictor-driven Logic Synthesis Optimization framework achieving up to 21% QoR improvement and 14x faster execution.
Developed a simulation platform to accurately map (tiling and multi-core scheduling) tensor operations onto Huawei's Ascend Cube tensor accelerator.
Exploited the simulator to benchmark tensor reshaping and vector reordering strategies, proposing novel software-level optimizations that effectively reduce power consumption.
2025 DAC, 2025 ICLAD.
Engineered an asynchronous PointNet-based embedding, enabling continuous spatio-temporal data conversion into dense tensors for seamless, continuous feeding of Transformer models.

Designed an NPU-compatible, block-wise sparse scaled dot-product attention module for highly efficient flash attention in Transformers, achieving more than 50% FLOPs reduction during inference and higher accuracy.
Enhanced performance by incorporating a cutting-edge SLAM pipeline for multi-modal training process, achieving 6x faster model convergence and a 15% accuracy improvement.

achievement_group: SW/HW Co-Design Automation with Neural Architecture Search
achievement_text: Built an AI-driven, Hardware-Aware Neural Architecture Search framework. Reduced model FLOP cost to 8% of the original, with only a 4% accuracy loss.

achievement_group: SW/HW Co-Design Automation with Neural Architecture Search
achievement_text: Integrated a Design Space Exploration software in the NAS loop to estimate energy and latency of model execution.
Conducted a literature study, featured in CTO's strategic report.
Implemented an AI model leveraging CNN and Transformer architectures to realize advanced frame generation.
Built a live demo of the model, from image sensor to application. This led to 2 major collaborations with other teams.
Packaged the model as an API to simplify sharing across teams and projects.
Responsible for the CI of a few Python libraries shared among teams.
2023 ISSCC.
Created a toolbox to automate component assembly of the Trace and Debug subsystem with ARM's Armv9-A SoC modules.
Developed an RTL generator for STM32 MPU SoC, streamlining the design of a multi-clock-domain reset and clock-control system for over 300 peripherals.
Conducted CoreMark benchmarking on a multi-core MPU SoC, highlighting significant performance gains (up to 6x) through compiler updates.
2021 ISSCC.

position: Doctoral Researcher on AI and Digital IC Design
achievement_text: The overall Ph.D. study led to the invention and patenting of a robust and accurate image sensor with AI capabilities in a single 3D integrated heterogeneous system-on-chip. The stack is composed of an Event-Based pixel grid, and a single layer convolutional neural network that accesses the pixels directly.

position: Doctoral Researcher on AI and Digital IC Design
achievement_text: Conducted a comprehensive literature review on scalable, distributed, multi-chip neuromorphic hardware, leading to a widely cited publication in ACM JETC.

position: Doctoral Researcher on AI and Digital IC Design
achievement_text: Built (RTL design, synthesis and layout) an ultra-low-power sparse AI accelerator, setting energy efficiency records (2.86pJ/OP in 28nm) and enabling seamless integration for 3D-stacked imagers.

position: Doctoral Researcher on AI and Digital IC Design
achievement_group: EB VIO/SLAM Pipeline and Object Detection Innovation
achievement_text: Developed an Event-Based VIO/SLAM pipeline with ego-motion compensation, leading to a solution for detecting moving objects.

position: Doctoral Researcher on AI and Digital IC Design
achievement_group: EB VIO/SLAM Pipeline and Object Detection Innovation
achievement_text: Invented a method for detecting objects from reconstructed ego-motion compensated event-based frames.

position: Doctoral Researcher on AI and Digital IC Design
achievement_text: 1 PhD manuscript; 2 conference papers; 1 journal paper; 3 patents; supervised 3 master's thesis; 1 pursued industrial project; tens of internal knowledge sharing presentations.

position: Doctoral Researcher on AI and Digital IC Design
achievement_text: 2019 ISSCC, 2021 DAC.
Teaching printed circuit board design and processes for analog electronics at Grenoble Institute of Technology.
Automated wafer-scale memory device characterization, reducing execution time from days to hours.
Contributed to the optimization of PCM technologies for Compute-in-Memory-based AI acceleration.
1 master's thesis; 1 patent; 1 paper; 1 poster; several internal presentations.
